title: Where is My Mind? (Cover Song)
text: I do a vocal + piano laid back version at shows. However, I’ve changed up my setup so I’ve decided to do a solo piano version. First heard it at the end of Fight Club like everyone else — how vanilla am I?

title: Still Alive (Portal)
text:
I got some inspiration to try and create the effect from Portal, a.k.a. GLaDOS. It’s a lot of fun—there are things I could have smoothed out—but I’m satisfied with this pass.
The song is Still Alive and by the great and creative Jonathan Coulton—check out his website: jonathancoulton.com

title: Still Alive (Portal)

title: My Mind (Original Song)
text: I wrote this song while I was living on Susan Butcher’s Dogsled farm. I was in college at the time and living in a dry cabin, that is, a cabin without running water. I will fondly remember my days living on Trail Breaker Kennel. It was right next to the airport and I became immune to landing jet noise.

title: About
text: Craig is a musician (piano, vocals, guitar) and producing artist residing in Juneau, Alaska. Craig began playing piano at age seven and studied with Sue Kazama throughout middle/high school. He participated in the JDHS Jazz band and was selected for the All Alaska Jazz Band directed by Bill Watrous in 2004–2005. The Jazz band is part of the Sitka Jazz Festival. He briefly studied music at the University of Alaska Fairbanks, where he accidentally enrolled in a 400-level history of music course, then later earned a business degree with a concentration in finance.

title: About
text: Craig is a musician (piano, vocals, guitar) and producing artist residing in Juneau, Alaska. Craig began playing piano at age seven and studied with Sue Kazama throughout middle/high school. He participated in the JDHS Jazz band and was selected for the All Alaska Jazz Band directed by Bill Watrous in 2004–2005. The Jazz band is part of the Sitka Jazz Festival. He briefly studied music at the University of Alaska Fairbanks, where he accidentally enrolled in a 400-level history of music course, then later earned a business degree with a concentration in finance.

title: About
section: The College Years and Return to Juneau (2011 – 2017)
text:
The College Years and Return to Juneau (2011 – 2017)
During that time he started a band with Annie B, Eli Barry-Garland, and Megan Packee called Annie Where The Sun Don’t Shine. They performed at venues including the UAF Pub and The Marlin, playing Annie Bartholomew’s original works and blues hits.
After returning to Juneau, Craig co-founded and named The Flustered Cluckers, a bluesy rock cover band that played Brewfest, The JACC, McGivney’s, The Rendezvous, The Rockwell, and the Juneau Maritime Festival. Founding members included Sophie Lager, Alexei Painter, Craig Millard, and Yoshi Tanha, with additional members Darren Jaeckel and Luke Weld. Craig also performed solo at McGivney’s with originals and covers.

title: About
section: Australian Hiatus, Pandemic Repatriation, and Return to Juneau #2 (2017 – Present)
text:
Australian Hiatus, Pandemic Repatriation, and Return to Juneau #2 (2017 – Present)
Craig took a long break from music while living and working in Australia from 2017 to 2020. After returning during the pandemic, he founded The Royal Wedding Band with Taylor Dallas Vidic, Tim Powers, David Elrod, and Sam Roberts. The band opened The Crystal Saloon and performed “hits from the 20s to the 20s.” They played venues across Alaska, including weddings. Additional members included Rob Cohen, Luke Weld, Chazz Gist, and Ceanne.
Craig has performed at multiple Alaska Folk Festivals and Mudrooms.

title: About
text:
Production Skills
Craig is a software developer by trade and merges that with creative work in music and video. He’s especially interested in MIDI-controlled environments. One recent project included a background video for a talent portion in the Miss Gay America national pageant.
Tools:

Adobe Premiere / After Effects

Ableton 12 (10+ years)

UAD Plugins + Apollo Twin

Audacity (15+ years)

OBS

Musescore

LightKey

title: Mr. Blue (Cover Song)
text:
If you do ever get to talk to me about television I will probably hit you with the Bojack recommendation. I think consensus is it warms up into season two, but I actually don’t mind the first season.
I think the very adult subject matter throws a lot of people off since sprinkled in are animal jokes—there is a bit of dissonance between the fun puns and existentialist depression. If you watch the whole thing you might hear this song.

title: Santeria (Cover Song) with UA plugins
text:
This is a video of me covering Santeria by Sublime. I’m not an expert on video production, but I do know it is very important to get your llamas in frame- whether they be of the cup or stuffed variety.


I also used a UA Apollo Twin as the interface, and everything was tracked in Ableton. The video was synced and edited in Premiere.

title: Sweetwater – A 3D Player Piano
text:
This is an arrangement I made featuring four voices. I originally got the idea from the player piano from the Westworld intro, but I wanted to expand on it — having it move through space on three axes. To make things even more compelling I wanted a time-synced effect with each voice.


After I recorded the performance on a green screen and 4K camera, I used After Effects, Visual Studio Code + Adobe plugin, and Tone.js to render the MIDI data. The mixing was done in Ableton.



Green screen and Seaboard RISE 25

title: Sweetwater – A 3D Player Piano
text:
This is an arrangement I made featuring four voices. I originally got the idea from the player piano from the Westworld intro, but I wanted to expand on it — having it move through space on three axes. To make things even more compelling I wanted a time-synced effect with each voice.


After I recorded the performance on a green screen and 4K camera, I used After Effects, Visual Studio Code + Adobe plugin, and Tone.js to render the MIDI data. The mixing was done in Ableton.



Green screen and Seaboard RISE 25

title: Sweetwater – A 3D Player Piano
text:
Products and Libraries

ROLI Seaboard RISE 25

Tone.js

Types for Adobe

Visual Studio Code

Node.js

Adobe After Effects

ExtendScript Debugger for VSCode

I also used Premiere/Media Encoder for the final render. The ExtendScript debugger was pretty rough to use, as was walking the property arrays within After Effects to figure out how to render rectangles from MIDI data. I’ll consider alternatives. I love AE, but a good scripting interface is a must these days.

title: Sweetwater – A 3D Player Piano
text:
My Code
To be fair to those who wrote the extension, it’s probably not as bad as this code that drew the rectangles from the MIDI data (generated object by Tone.js). However, I haven’t found a better documented way for drawing rectangles, so I may take some time to refactor this — it’s something I’m sure other people would like to do too.
https://github.com/craigmillard/sweetwater-visuals/



MIDI rectangles drawn into AE
